availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Grayson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Barton. Father of Adaline Barton, Milly A. Barton, Clark Barton, Sarah E. Barton, Hannah E. Barton, Mary C. Barton, John N. Barton, Jacob C. Barton, Louisa P. Barton, and E. J. Barton. Farmer in Grayson County in 1850 and 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 51A. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 84. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, Carry Precinct, p. 36.
